column2: The resolution to which anatomical images should be transformed during registration.
column3:
1 An integer indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 1mm, 2mm, 3mm, 4mm);
2 A float number indicating three same dimensions (e.g., 3.5mm etc.); 3 Three numbers connected by 'x' indicating three different dimensions (e.g., 2.67mmx2.67mmx3mm etc.)

column2: Reference template for resampling during registration. Normally the default value (seen in the example YAML) is fine.
Reference template for resampling during registration. Normally the default value (seen in the example YAML) is fine.
Use either ANTS or FSL (FLIRT and FNIRT) as your anatomical registration method.
Configuration file to be used by FSL to set FNIRT parameters.
Configuration file to be used by FSL to set FNIRT parameters.
Register skull-on anatomical image to a template.
column3: A list where ‘1’ represents ‘yes’ and ‘0’ represents ‘no’ (e.g., ‘[1]’).

column2: Disables skull-stripping on the anatomical inputs if they are already skull-stripped.
column3: A list where ‘1’ represents ‘yes’ and ‘0’ represents ‘no’ (e.g., ‘[1]’).

column2: Parameters setting for antsRegistration.The user can specify any number of 'stages' where a stage consists of a transform; an image metric; and iterations, shrink factors, and smoothing sigmas for each level. Note that explicitly setting the dimensionality, metric, transform, output, convergence, shrink-factors, and smoothing-sigmas parameters is mandatory.
column3: See below for a full specification of parameters.
